divs: Sighting DetailsLooking sse from our house about 6 miles south of sullivan and 6 miles east of Findlay. Just over the treetops. A glow appeared lasting approximately 5 seconds. The glow was bigger than a star or plane lights. It did not flash or grow or fade or move. When it disappeared, another one immediately appeared a distance away from it -- more southward. A delay of a few minutes, then another one appeared at a similar location, but not the exact location. While it was similar to the glow of a fireworks, it did not arc or move in any way. And it did not slowly appear or fade away.... rather it just appeared and disappeared. Both my husband and I saw these lights -- a total of about 7 or 8. In addition, we saw a falling star to our east during this period of 10 minutes, along with fireworks several miles to our west. We also saw what we assumed was a plane, except it's light did not pulsate and it appeared to bounce along -- not fly in a straight line like the other plane lights we observed at the same time. This light was to our north moving westward.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Findlay
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: flashes or glow of reddish orange lights
